activities: Alpine has a mobile phone app for remotely tuning car audio settings. At the initial download step, users have the opportunity to review the privacy policy.  Also, users must provide their email address at this step. Additionally, Alpine is able to track users’ location if GPS is activated in the mobile phone. Alpine will not sell or transfer this personal data to any third party. Alpine may use email addresses for targeted ads, to which users can unsubscribe, and possibly use location data to internally study location based advertising.  However, Alpine's main focus is on non-personal information pulled through the app to study users’ habits, such as preferred audio settings, car and car radio type, phone type, etc.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
industrysector: Consumer Electronics - (CEL)Audio/Visual Equipment - (AUV)Automotive Parts & Service Equipment - (APS)
personaldata: customer data= 1) email addresses and; 2) location information if GPS in mobile phone is activated
recoursemech: Alpine agrees to arbitration through the American Arbitration Association (AAA) for settling complaints unresolved through Alpine's internal process (Users can access their info by contacting Alpine.  Alpine will remove, edit, delete users' data at their request).
